comments.body: Well, if we stick to realism, the friction between the water and the string in the bow would slow down the arrow, that‚Äôs why bows do not work underwater. However, the idea of having a long-range weapon underwater is cool. That‚Äôs why tridents exist. Also, let me remind you that trindents have more attack power than diamond swords. I understand your enthusiasm, so, keep thinking to make better!

@Javier Humberto Cordova Vazquez

I understand that we have tridents but they're also very hard to come by.

I for one like the idea of a prismarine arrow. Also, since when has Minecraft been a "realistic" game?

Since the idea is tagged as "needs info," I'll expand on it.

I feel a Prismarine Arrow would be crafted with a Feather, Stick, and Prismarine Shard. It would yield 4 arrows, like the normal arrow crafting recipe does and deals the same damage as regular arrows do. Their only difference would be they could travel underwater.

This gives Prismarine Shards a greater use and more of a reason to hunt for Guardians. And hey, you could use the shards you get from the Guardians to craft more arrows to get more shards to get more arrows. XD
Well, that's a totally different experience.
Tridents.
Isn't this what tridents are for though?

I know this is what tridents are for, but these would be cool because they are made of prismarine and just suggesting that prismarine might have poison in once fired into flesh. It would be like tridents with poison so I think this would be really cool
Agree this is what tridents are for. All I can think of is load trident in a crossbow but that just sounds ridiculous.
But if we also stuck to realism then a dragon wouldn‚Äôt exist now would it
dude it is just a underwater arrow it doesn't have to be realistic it's MINECRAFT

This needs more explanation but is a cool idea

Dr. Thezbi Kazo half-approves of this idea
It‚Äôs possible to walk through paintings.

Maybe as a creative only feature, intended for map makers like barriers and light blocks
They would be creative!
Yes but how? Any specific ideas for us?
like dyeing all armors?
like dyeing all armors!

I think it'd be cool if you could combine Leather and Chainmail into a new type of armor, which would be around as good as Diamond (or potentially better), and like Leather, would be dyeable.

This armor would have very high resistance against melee attacks, but would be about as good as iron against projectiles.

This would make Chainmail something actually worth collecting, and give Leather armor more worth as well.
Maybe with items in dungeons or blacksmiths
That will be wonderful!

Absolutely love this idea! My scarecrows could have different faces. The Pale Jack-o-lantern should also have a matching overlay when worn by the player. It could have bigger eyes/ be less view obscuring, giving another reason for the player to seek out the pale pumpkin.
The carved variant should also spawn occasionally as part of these pale pumpkin patches, they would be unlit in the day, but light up at night.  Great idea though!
Maybe the pale pumpkin would scare endermen instead of just making them not attack you too
White and grey variants (maybe dark green as well) would look cool.
It works like a pumpkin, but no annoying overlay
this idea is very good giving us another pumpkins to decorate/incorporate into builds
I haven't played Story Mode, but I'd adore white pumpkins. It'd be very nice for monochrome builds.
Add the floater and make it made of heavy core. Also make wind charge as its fuel then the players wont fly for ever without fuel.  Could be like 1 windcharge make it move 500blocks distance

It would be amazing if they added this block to 1.21.  They said tinkering and combat.  A good amount of combat was added now us tinkerers are just waiting for the other half of the update.  This one block would make it up to us!
we really do need the floatater it could actually change Minecraft for the better and that says allot Minecraft is already the best game.

(replying to https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/25537185576717/comments/25592553987469)

I feel like the heavy core wouldn't make sense. I'd say a new item that drops from shulkers, but it would have to be a really rare drop, like the trident. (Shulkers because they give the levitation effect)
Or, it could have a low chance for a degraded version of it to generate in end ships. It would have to be fairly expensive to fix.

Also, I love your idea of recharging with wind charges.
We want flotater in minecraft pls Minecraft

The flotater would be a good addition to Minecraft as it can be used for many different things, for example: Having the ability for ALL players to make their own functioning/moving things.

Me personally, I would like to make my own functioning rocketship, airplane, car, and boat. I know that some other people would love to make their own functioning things too. Its not just me but its many.

Rename it as Floater Block. It can only push blocks you can push with the piston and able to push about 16 blocks before needing more of the Floater. Make the craft recipe surrounding a Redstone block with four iron ingots and four wind charges, and PLEASE, add it to vanilla.

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: ‚ÄúBamboo blocks‚Äù

Text: ‚ÄúAdd bamboo blocks, steps, half-blocks, fences, gates, doors, stairs, torches, frames. This would expand the possibilities of bamboo and add a bunch of beautiful blocks!‚Äù

- Translated by Admin

As a builder this would give a great more variety for Japanese builds, bridges etc. i think you would need more bamboo to make certain thigs since its a very easy material once you get your hands on it. This would create many possibilities for other builds as well. say when you make a wall out of bamboo it would make it look like some points are higher or lower. This will create a lot of creativity!!!

a bamboo block would also be great for smelting - bamboo by itself is decent for smelting but you need to hook it directly up to a farm (or mass storage) to be efficient - a compressed bamboo kind of block that smelts the same as coal would be great
Great idea! I'd also love if there could be Dried Bamboo Blocks to add that could be used for a Jungle Village
I really want new types of wood. Just for the fun of it, it would be awesome!
it should make a white shade of wood
Then there will be a sakura forest that is rare. Also the leave must fall after it snows or rains.
Hopefully it's not as big as sakuras forhead

ikr? I wonder why we don't have more fruits yet.... it feels like something should be added years ago XD

It could be a really gritty electric guitar note, like from an 80's hair band guitar solo.

It'd be perfect for activating just before a boss on an adventure map.
You should put the noteblock thing in the title. I didn't know what it was when I clicked on it.

I was actually thinking something very similair, but it would be with blackstone, (easier for survival builds xD) Maybe have it so it's different degrees of heavy, or different tones of electric guitar? Or maybe one's a bass?
I like this
I agree one should fully be able to live in the neither and fined essentials like dimonds

Instead of putting diamonds in any nether biome, perhaps have them spawn in just basalt deltas. This would make diamonds rare enough in the nether where they wouldn't allow players to just strip mine indefinitely for them, and I believe diamonds, as well as this kimberlite you speak of, would fit nicely in basalt deltas. This would incentivize the exploration of basalt deltas they lack piglin bastions. Having diamonds would make up for this quite well!

Sorry if I didn‚Äôt make this clear. 1) kimberlite is a real life rock that often forms diamonds.
2) They are formed in magma plumes under immense pressure (formed alongside basalt)
3) It is basalt delta specific. Meaning it only spawns in the basalt deltas, and only below y-level 31

If any one has questions let me know...
there are a lot of things consle dosent have but PC does i am on consle and i would like it if you added the PC updates to consle .

Maybe have it function like Gilded Blackstone, sometimes you get a Diamond or sometimes just the block if mined with an Iron pick or higher without a Fortune III enchantment, and it cannot be smelted in the furnace.

I like where you are going, A great new use for the loom would be to put designs on carpets similar to banners or patterns like the carpets in the Chinese mythology texture pack.

I know carpets are a partial block I think is 1/8th? It makes sense then to spin 8 carpet from one wool block which you can spin a pattern onto 8 carpet sections at a time.

Another similar use would be to customize the blankets and pillows on beds by using a solid color bed as the default item like a plain banner, then customizing the blanket & possibly the pillow in a limited way. I have seen people suggest placing the banners on the beds but I think the loom makes more sense and expands its functionality & potential.
Thats not how looms work in real life
I think if we get this in Minecraft I think we should use it for dyeing shields üõ°

One use I would like to see is the ability to add 'icons' onto banners.
Why icons? Well this would be useful for map makers when using maps on banners to reveal icons on maps, just like Grand Theft Auto does with their icons.

 

Icons would come from items combined with banners on the loom table.
Maybe also give the loom the ability to apply patterns to carpets and beds.
I think you should brew it different than that
Awesome! Best idea since fire aspect!
How should server owners be able to tell a hacker from a normal player? Surely anti-cheats would go mental.
I think that it will work like the way spider's climb up walls. In case you didn't know spiders are always on ladders so they can check by placing an object that sticks out from the wall.

Usage:

in a big cave and you see diamonds? down it and ender pearl up there!

wanna build a bridge more safely and tired of pressing crouch the whole time? drink that juice! (but keep in mind that ghasts and phantoms are your number one enemies at that moment)

wanna climb that mountain packed with very confusing ways to the top? that potion isnt THAT expensive.

you want to prevent a mob reaching you? splash that mob!

wanna be spiderman and surprise someone? no problem! combine it with invisibility and hug that ceiling

you want to improve something small on your big building but don't wanna have to remove all that dirt? sticky potion is your friend!

No,I believe it is better if the potion with sticky effect, when used it's effect should be the same as of the honey blocks. But unlike the honey blocks, it's effect should work on any blocks in Minecraft except on terracotta and any other blocks that doesn't stick.
I love this idea! It's unique and useful. Additionally, honey/honeycombs could benefit from more utility, and this potion is an excellent way of making them more useful!
I think a bamboo blowpipe would be fun.

I think that is all together a great idea but, being able to pole volt when your not running/walking seems a little unrealistic. 

if you would change this weapon so that the player to walking  then doing the pole volt action they would   have a shorter and slower vole distance,  but If one runs one has a quicker/ longer volt distance. drinking a speed potion would effect your voting speed as well as being hit by slowness. 

thank you for making this feedback/ request I highly agree with this poster.

Maybe a special spinning attack enchantment that hits anything within the radius of the player would make it more of a useful weapon. My require skill to do but would provide an interesting variation to 1.9 PvE/PvP

I think that its strength should be that it attacks faster than a normal sword -- maybe 10-25% more? -- but it has a 15-25% chance(?) to deal damage to the attacker (as if you're hitting yourself). There would be an enchantment called "Precision" or something that lowers the chance by 5% for every level of the enchantment. Great idea!
This would be really cool and would give a cool new use for bamboo. I love the idea. üëç

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360011221551-Become-a-Wizard- 

Perhaps you could post more spell ideas in the comment section here.

What do you mean?  Do you want a bigger spell list?

Why did you add a link to the other idea?  I think it's too different to my suggestion to be the same idea, if that's what you're trying to imply.

I've realized that such spells would be way to powerful, considering how easy their ingredients are to get.  Therefore, I think that spell books should wear out after a few uses, and are crafted with a book in the center, enchanting tables on the edges, and brewing stands on the corners.  That would force players to use them sparingly and wisely.

The spells should be an after end game feature since they are almost commands disguised as books or be a drop for the illusioner.
Spells should affect an area of 4 chunks: the chunk the player is standing, the north chunk, the east chunk and the northeast chunk. Making a 32x32 blocks area of effect. And should affect only the blocks that are in the same height of the block the player is stepping.

For the spell os fertility, the tick rate of the affected area would be increased meaning that not only crops grows faster and mobs spawns more often also grass/fire spread to adjacent blocks faster.
What if the player were facing west?
Still happening on north and east. If facing west then everything will happens at his backs

The spell books or grimoire (I think this name is bether) could be combined in an anvil with an end rod to craft a magic wand/spell staff. The grimoires are single use and the staff have a durability.
That doesn't make any sense.  Shouldn't it happen in front of the player no matter what?

But why do we need spell books?
These spells could be commands, lines of commands once only avaliable with cheats and on creative, now into items obtainable on survival without cheating.

You'd be able to change your spawn point and spawn chunks with the spell of Homeland;

Change to day or night with Aurora or Twilight respectively;

Make it rain or snow with Precipitation;

make the storm or rain stops with Clear Sky;

Eliminate a few blocks with your already suggested Desintegration but to fit in the theme of nature and environment, name it Tectonic;

 

Change the light level of an area, regardless of the sky light level or nearby light sources, to 7 with the Darkness but named Penumpral instead;

 

Change the light level of an area to 15 regardless of sky light level with Halos.

It doesn't make sense because am thinking in how coordinates works and how these spell could work using the commands that already exist

 

What if the spell affect a rounded area around the player instead?

These spells should not involve commands.  They should be obtainable in survival mode without cheats.  I think that they should be craftable, but have low durability and require rare items.  That way, players would be forced to use them sparingly.  I really don't understand what you're saying about commands.  Commands should have nothing to do with spells.

I like the idea of spells affecting the environment while enchantments affects items; and potions affects players and mobs. So the spells must be related to nature phenomena, such as time of the day, weather (not thunderstorms), terrain modifications, gravity and natural light.

 

Here's my concept of how to get a grimoire (spell book): you need to defeat the illusioner, that will spawn inside his circus, a colorful wool structure generated on plains biome (but this topic is for other page, focus on the items) and it will drop one grimoire with a random spell

 

Or a drop for this new mob: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360027718191-Ancient-Grimoire-Mob

 

What is rarest than a drop of a mob that only spawns along with his structure, never after? (the totem of undying is one of them)
The player shouldn't be able to summon a thundertorm, even in a small area, because with channeling enchantment on trident it would facilitate too much the creation of charged creepers
Aren't charged creepers something you don't want to encounter?

Yes, you don't want one of those temperamental guys walking through your house but they're very usefull for making wither skeleton skull farms, since the wither skeletons will always drop their head when killed by their explosion.

Be able to summon a thunderstorm make this kind of farm and gathering lots of beacons too easy, thats the point.
I see what you mean.  No thunder spell then.
The Spell of Fear would works better as a potion since it affects mobs making them avoid an area.
I think it makes a better spell because it affects all mobs, not just the ones that get hit by it.  Also, if it were a potion, what area would the mobs avoid?
I appreciate the time you're taking to critique this idea, by the way.

There should be a separation between what is a spell and what is a potion, both are linked but make different things. Because of the ability to affect the behavior of mobs making them avoid entering an area, the spell of fear looks better as a potion, also it deserves it's own thread in my opinion.

The Potion of Fear causes the Phobia effect and any mob under it will run away from the player (i. e. Ocelots and rabbits already do this) and players with the phobia effect wouldn't be able to walk, paralyzed by the fear.
You're welcome. I liked your idea and I want it to be implemented in a future update

I like the spell of flammability, devs could add the tag 'flammable" for the blocks and this spell makes every block in a certain radius (maybe 4 block in each direction forming a 9x9 centered on the player) flammable and sets them on fire! Destructive! Better you grab some potions of fire resistance too.

Why not call it Overheat?
How would spell of protection works?

You're right about the phobia effect.  It makes sense for it to be a potion.  I also like your idea about how the flammability spell should work.

I think it's time to update my idea.

the flammability spell (or overheat spell) is very useful for pvp and with the fertility spell (faster tickspeed) together they're useful for cleaning an great area consuming the blocks faster than normal
I don't think the fertility spell should increase the tick speed, because I don't want it to affect fire.  Also, if the tick speed were increased, wouldn't it affect the whole world?

Maybe the Fertility Spell could then affect crops making them pass from the actual stage of growing to the next till get fully grown, make grass/mycelium/podzol blocks spread to adjacent dirt blocks, grow up sugar cane/cactus/chorus/kelp/bamboo to maximum height and grow huge mushrooms from mushrooms and trees from saplings. The effect of  Fertility could last 5 seconds growing everything in a 9x9x9 cubic (the coordinates where the player stands are the center of the cuboid)
this way, fertility has no bond with destruction anymore

Wouldn't that just be glorified bone meal?  Maybe it should do that and make them grow faster for a short period of time (by decreasing the number of ticks required to advance to the next stage of growth).  Perhaps it should also fertilize blocks that do not normally support plant growth?

There are different types of ticks in the game: redstone tick, game tick and chunk tick/block tick.

my Idea was to the spell of fertility increase the block tick for a given area.
But is the tick that controls fire the same tick that controls plant growth?

The fertility spell is supposed to grow plants faster, in 5 sec. the plants should grow so faster that you will lose the show if you blink and if you are fast enough you can harvest and plant some of them to be more efficient, sorry if I wasn't explicit on my idea.

You mean planting sugar cane on mycelium, stone or so?
Yes, I do mean that.  They'd stop growing once the spell stops though.
the block ticks are random ticks within chunks sections and it controls many events https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Tick#Block_tick
And plant seeds on sand or stone too... nice idea, the utility is very specific but is useful for who don't have dirt (considering player is on custom worlds). Fertility is a good spell.
To balance lets set a cost for casting the spells, what should it be? consume experience points? Or consume specific ingredients every time you want to use it? Both?

Perhaps.  Originally I was thinking that the crafting recipe for a spell book/wand should require very rare items, but I like your idea better.  Should it consume lapis lazuli like enchantments do, or should there be another gemstone (How about rubies?) that is specifically used for spell casting?

The lectern is a block specific for the spells it's interface may be similar to the enchanting table, you put the spell book in there and pick a random spell, exchanging experience points and specific ingredients for each spell, once you fulfilled the requirements, the imbuing process will start, similar to the brewing of a potion. This may fits well with the magic brothers.
Perfect!

The additions you made are awesome! What about a brightness spell, using glow stone and with the opposite effect of the darkness spell (level light 15)? I still thinking about the end rod being used as the magic wand, though.
I think witches should not cast spells, they would be so OP. Maybe a special witch spellcaster without potions (only self-use potions).
What's OP?  Is it a Minecraft-specific term?
Do end rods have any other purpose?
By the way, I have not made any "addictions".
Am sorry, I wanted to mean "additions".
"OP" means overpowered, too powerful.
The end rod is a light source already. I change my mind about it be used as the spell staff. Add a new item does more sense indeed.
I agree.  Maybe there should be a wizard mob that casts spells.
Will the spell staff break after the use or will it lose the spell and one durability point?
I'm not sure.

I think about losing some experience points (not necessarily levels) as a cost instead of losing the staff or the spell. And using the spell again without waiting a "cooldown time" would increase the cost. Just to prevent spamming.
There should be a way to summon evocation fangs with the item

This would be this would be so cool! But mebe it should be that u can also give books the same effect and craft them at the lecterns too and have spell tomes, like a rod but a book, and it can be held in off hand and stuff and maybe tome spells can affect players and creatures instead of environments( like sending an energy bolt to hit a monster.)

If there‚Äôs one area of minecraft where there‚Äôs a lack of features, it‚Äôs magic. For the player, the only commonly used magic system is enchanting. Potions are niche, and tipped arrows aren‚Äôt worth the effort. Solution? The scroll system. Scrolls are difficult to get, though far more applicable than most potions.  

Scrolls are used for casting spells, and each one has 50 uses, along with an experience cost. Scrolls would be made with a Scroll Table, a new crafting system. The table has four slots, one for a spell tome - determines effect, one for 1-3 amethysts - determines scroll power, one for paper - base item, one for scroll - resulting item. Spell tomes would be obtained rarely from enchanting books, or as loot in End chests. Effects would include fireballs, damaging and slowing snowballs, armor reducing, health drain, and summoning spells, like a friendly vex equivalent. Amethysts would be found on the underside of end islands, in small veins. This would make amethysts and therefore scrolls difficult to get, but the utility of scrolls would make them well worth the effort of obtaining. Inputting more amethysts would increase the power of the crafted scrolls.

With the Caves and Cliffs Update introducing amethyst, I think it would be better if staff had infinite uses, but they had a cooldown and required amethyst shards to use, making amethyst some sort of SP or mana. That would give an incentive to return to geodes.

If they don't want to use rubies I think lapis lazuli would be a better choice than diamond. Lapis comes in such a large quantity when mined and is already used in enchantments, so it's already related to magic. I feel like the harvesting spell should use a gold hoe as well since gold also seems to have some correlation with magic since gold gets better enchantments than any other ore.
f u
Great idea but Mabey use more than once??
this will be better if the spell use the xp bar as your mana because this bar actually occupied to much place for he resources that only spend for upgrading your weapons

Eh...

I think the access to prismarine, sea lanterns, and the sponges are prize enough for defeating the monument.
Miscategorized; would fit better to the Structures section.

You could have hidden chests. That would be awesome!

Maybe with Silk Touch pickaxes?
I think there is no reason to loot a ocean temple at it's current place. Adding chests would give me a reason to raid them and make water breathing potions, night vision.

What I'd be looking for is not necessarily loot chests like other dungeons -- just something to make ocean monuments worth taking over.  Right now, the only reason I'd ever raid a monument would be for the blocks or the experience.  This may be enough, but for the massive and glorious structure that it is, it seems a little bit underwhelming.

Some chests with nautilus shells, enchanted books (favoring trident and other water related enchantments) and some other treasures similar to mansion and end/ancient cities would be great.

Also, a trident. Elder guardians could drop pieces or replacing one of the gold blocks with a chest containing a trident and other high end loot.

The only thing is I would suggest having a recipe to make this item, even if it's as simple as two furnaces next to each other in the 2x2 crafting grid.  It seems unnecessary to have it as an in-world craft, and I can just imagine the annoyance of people who are trying to build super-smelters and keep accidentally making a fusion forge.

I do think having the ability to make alloys would open up interesting new options for tools and armor with special properties and encourage adding more ores.
Maybe it could be made by putting two blast furnaces next to each other instead of regular furnaces!
It would have been great in they hadn't indtroduced Netherite...
the steel should be a lighter gray.
The dark steel ingot looks way too similar to netherite.
I was about to post about adding corn and than I saw this, and this is exactly what I was thinking.

I like this idea! It can add a lot to the visuals of farms by having crops with different heights, which I'm sure the building community would love. Corn mazes are also really popular in the United States (I'm not sure about elsewhere), so it would be fun to have a way to introduce that into the game. Maybe corn mazes could even make their way into minecraft dungeons or something if a corn crop is introduced.

Corn would also be perfect for mazes! It should slow you down when you walk inside of it just as cobwebs do, so if you want to farm it in bulk, you'll be forced to dig out some kind of maze. It could also have a top texture so you can see the layout of your corn maze from above!
Pop corn, kettle corn, cheese corn, ect :)
Corn could also be used to make tortillas, tacos, or bread.
plase do this mojang.
Beetroot carrots potatoes wheat no corn?

Im thinking that corn should also be able to grow on mud, and if it is on mud it shouldn't need water. Also, maybe if mojang wants to add a layer of activity to gain the corn, you should get teosinte seeds from sniffers, grow it, and have a very rare chance of the teosinte dropping corn kernels, thus unlocking corn. This would add another completionist goal
Personally, I think a much simpler addition would be to make it so pale wood blocks make a similar sound to other wood blocks, but with more creaking.

tomatoes and rice!
Yes tomatoes and rice
